SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.main

Class MainListeners

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.main.MainListeners
class MainListeners extends Object
Represents the UI handling for instances of Main, MainPanelUI and InfoPanelUI, managing user interactions and events within the panels.

Fields:
  • main - a Main reference to the main application entry point
  • mainPanelUI - a MainPanelUI reference to the UI of the main panel
  • mainCardsLayout - a CardLayout that contains all panels added to mainCards from main
  • plannerTableManager - a reference to a new PlannerTableManager instance which contains the DefaultTableModel for the week planner and manages its data and updates
Methods:
  • setupListeners() - adds listeners to the components from mainPanelUI and infoPanelsUI
  • createButtonsListener() - creates an ActionListener for JButtons from mainPanelUI and infoPanelsUI
  • createPlannerListener() - creates a MouseAdapter for the JTable representing week planner
  • configureWindowsAdapter() - sets the app's behaviour after closing it
  • deleteTask() - deletes a task from the week planner
  • cleanPlanner(String) - deletes all tasks or resets all points from the selected week day(s)
  • showInfo() - allows users to select kind of information shown in the app interface
  • showPanel(String) - shows a panel from mainCardsLayout which name is compatible with a passed String
  • refreshApp() - reloads and updates the application after changing the week planner in the JTable

  • Constructor Details

    • MainListeners

      MainListeners(Main main, MainPanelUI mainPanelUI, InfoPanelUI[] infoPanelsUI)
      Constructs a new MainListeners instance with the specified parameters. Assigns passed instances to references: main, mainPanelUI and infoPanelsUI. Retrieves the CardLayout instance from the com.floweektracker.main object and assigns it to the mainCardsLayout reference. Also retrieves the PlannerTableManager instance from mainPanelUI and assigns it to the plannerTableManager reference.

      At the end, calls setupListeners() to add listeners to the components.
      Parameters:
      main - an instance of Main
      mainPanelUI - an instance of MainPanelUI
      infoPanelsUI - an array of InfoPanelUI instances

  • Method Details

    • setupListeners

      private void setupListeners()
      Adds listeners to the components from MainPanelUI and InfoPanelUI instances. It also adds listener to the app's window.
      See Also:
      • MainListeners(Main, MainPanelUI, InfoPanelUI[])
      • createButtonsListener()
      • createPlannerListener()
      • configureWindowsAdapter()

    • createButtonsListener

      private ActionListener createButtonsListener()

      Creates and returns an ActionListener for buttons. Depending on the clicked button, the listener:

      • adds a task to the planner by invoking the PlannerDataManager.addTask() and the refreshApp() method,
      • creates a new TasksDatabaseUI instance for adding a task to the database,
      • deletes a task from the planner by invoking the deleteTask() method,
      • deletes all tasks or resets all points from selected week day(s) by invoking cleanPlanner(String) method,
      • shows to the user one of the two kinds of information about application by invoking showInfo() method,
      • shows a main panel from mainCardsLayout instance to the user by invoking showPanel(String)method.
      Returns:
      an ActionListener for buttons from MainPanelUI and InfoPanelUI instances.
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • createPlannerListener

      private MouseListener createPlannerListener()
      Creates and returns a MouseListener for the planner. The listener handles user clicks on the week planner.
      • If user double-clicks on a weekday name, a new WeekDayPanelUI instance is created for the selected weekday, and the weekday panel from this instance is added to MainCards in main. At the end, created panel of a week day is shown to the user.
      • If user double-clicks on a task name, the PlannerDataManager.editTask(String, String) method is invoked, allowing the user to edit the selected task.
      Returns:
      a MouseListener for the JTable representing the week planner
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • configureWindowsAdapter

      private WindowAdapter configureWindowsAdapter()
      Creates and returns a WindowAdapter that defines the behaviour when the window is closed by the user. If user closes window, the PlannerDataManager.savePlanner() method is invoked to save the state of the planner. After saving, the Window.dispose() method is called to dispose the window and System.exit(int) is called to terminate the application.
      Returns:
      a WindowAdapter that handles the window closing event by saving the planner state, disposing the window, and exiting the application.
      See Also:
      • setupListeners()

    • deleteTask

      private void deleteTask()
      Deletes task from the JTable representing a weekday planner. Checks which cell was clicked by the user. If it is the task's name, the PlannerDataManager.deleteTask(String, String) method is invoked, which deletes task from the planner. If the task is deleted, the refreshApp() is invoked.
      See Also:
      • createButtonsListener()

    • cleanPlanner

      private void cleanPlanner(String actionCommand)
      Deletes all tasks or reset all achieved points from the selected weekdays chosen by the user. This method creates and shows a JOptionPane.showOptionDialog(Component, Object, String, int, int, Icon, Object[], Object) dialog allowing user to select weekdays. If user confirms their selection, the chosen weekdays are passed to the PlannerDataManager.cleanPlanner(HashSet, String) method along with the given actionCommand.
      Parameters:
      actionCommand - a String containing action command's name which is passed from createButtonsListener() method.
      See Also:
      • createButtonsListener()

    • showInfo

      private void showInfo()
      Creates and shows a JOptionPane.showOptionDialog(Component, Object, String, int, int, Icon, Object[], Object) dialog to the user, allowing them to choose a type of information to display. Depending on the user's choice, this method shows the corresponding JPanel from the mainCardsLayout.

      The options presented to the user are "Baza", "Planer" and "Anuluj". If the user selects "Baza" or "Planer", the corresponding panel is displayed, and the application's window is resized and centered.
      See Also:
      • createButtonsListener()

    • showPanel

      private void showPanel(String panelName)
      Displays the panel from the mainCardsLayout which name corresponds to the given panelName. Then sets the size of the JFrame by invoking the Main.setPanelSize(String) with panelName as the parameter, and centers the app's window on the screen.
      Parameters:
      panelName - a String representing the name of the panel to be shown to the user
      See Also:
      • createButtonsListener()
      • createPlannerListener()
      • showInfo()

    • refreshApp

      private void refreshApp()
      Reloads the app after making changes in the JTable representing the user's planner. Invokes the PlannerTableManager.refreshPlanner() method to reload the user's planner, sets the size of the JFrame using the Main.setPanelSize(String) method with "MainPanel" as the parameter and centers the window on the screen.
      See Also:
      • createButtonsListener()
      • createPlannerListener()
      • deleteTask()
      • cleanPlanner(String)
